p: Other identified compounds with relevant biological activity are: neophytadiene, dihydroactinidiolide, 2,4-di- tert-butylphenol (DTBP) and n-Nonadecanol-1. Neophytadiene, is a terpene compound that possess a strong bactericidal, antifungal, antipyretic, analgesic, antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties [ 35]; dihydroactinidiolide has cytotoxic effects against five human carcinoma cell lines and one melanoma cell line [ 36, 37]; DTBP was found to possess potent antioxidant effect [ 38, 39] in addition to fungicidal and cytotoxic activity against HeLa cancer cell line [ 40]. Finally, n-Nonadecanol-1, one of the major detected component in Ceratonia siliqua pods essential oil, demonstrated a strong cytotoxic effect against two cancer human cell lines, HeLa and MCF-7 [ 41].
